wordpressPost.title: How to Make Fridays More Fun at Work
wordpressPost.content:
Who doesn’t love Fridays?

It’s a great opportunity to take that project you’ve been working on all week over the finish line, spend some time reflecting on all you’ve accomplished throughout the week and get the latest data on how that new feature or product is performing against expectations. On top of all this stuff though, it’s also a great opportunity to have some fun with your co-workers. Things can get hectic and stressful during the week and Friday is a great time to stop for a second and share a good laugh with the people that worked through it all with you.
Here are a few ideas on how you could break up some of the monotony of the week on a Friday and get everyone to smile a little.
1. Office pranks: Pranks and jokes are a simple way to lighten the mood. Adding some flare to someone’s workspace can be both unexpected and hilarious when you see that person’s reaction. A good joke can go a long way and keep people laughing for the entire day, if not longer.

2. Play a game: The benefits of play for both adults and children seem to grow more and more as time goes on. As more people study the benefits of play to the brain it’s been credited for things like, deepening our connections with strangers, improving our ability to heal, and even shaping our brains
3. Buy your team lunch: A surprise free lunch is a great way to say thanks and bring the team together to all share a meal. Instead of people stuffing their faces in front of their computer monitors bring everyone together and have lunch to round off the week.
4. Get people moving: Getting people on their feet and moving around is a great way to get people thinking in new and different ways and also get the blood flowing.
5. Give the day a theme: Who doesn’t love a good costume? A simple way to get people out of their comfort zone is to get them out of their work uniform and into something a little different. It could be anything. Maybe it’s Star Wars, a crazy hat day, or 80’s day.
These are our ideas for making Fridays fun at work. Tell us your own ideas in the comments
